name: Org-Level Thinking
description: Assessed by: org topology clarity, cross-team ownership single-threading, re-org execution velocity, coordination overhead ratios, and strategic alignment metrics. Absence causes: ambiguous ownership creating coordination tax, re-orgs that destroy trust and attrition, scaling bottlenecks, and misalignment between org structure and architecture.

name: Strategic Prioritization
description: Assessed by: planning artifact quality, roadmap delivery rate, stakeholder alignment metrics, resource allocation transparency, and business ROI articulation. Absence causes: engineering work invisible to business, strategic misalignment, resource thrashing between competing priorities, and wasted engineering capacity.

name: Systems Design & Architecture
description: Assessed by: architecture decision records, design review process, SLO framework, tech debt registry, and migration execution. Absence causes: conflicting architectural decisions, compounding tech debt, reactive reliability investment, and failed migrations.

name: Operational Leadership & Rhythm
description: Assessed by: sprint commitment accuracy, delivery cadence consistency, toil reduction metrics, and developer focus time. Absence causes: unpredictable delivery, eroded stakeholder trust, meeting overhead displacing deep work, and compounding operational toil.

name: Cross-Functional Influence
description: Assessed by: cross-functional stakeholder satisfaction, influence on major decisions, stakeholder escalation reduction, and peer feedback credibility. Absence causes: misaligned initiatives, cross-functional blame games, delayed delivery from lack of coordination, and EM isolation from product/design leadership.

name: Coaching & Talent Development
description: Assessed by: skip-level conversation quality, performance review calibration rigor, promotion success rate, retention of high performers, and team growth velocity. Absence causes: high-potential talent leaves for development, performance reviews become recency-biased, weak managers go uncoached, and promotions feel arbitrary rather than earned.

name: Decision Framing & Communication
description: Assessed by: decision memo quality and approval rates, exec presentation crisp communication, proactive status updates, bad news flag timing, roadmap transparency, and DACI/RFC adoption. Absence causes: decisions revisited endlessly, stakeholder misalignment, late problem escalation, poor exec perception, and wasted organizational energy on rework.

name: Incidents, Risk & Reliability
description: Assessed by: incident MTTR, post-mortem action completion rate, on-call page volume, game day frequency, and error budget burn rate. Absence causes: prolonged outages, repeat incidents from unaddressed root causes, on-call burnout, and unmanaged operational risk.

name: Metrics, Measurement & Outcomes
description: Assessed by: DORA metric tracking, developer satisfaction measurement, OKR scoring discipline, business metric translation, and metric pairing against gaming. Absence causes: invisible delivery problems, unmeasured developer friction, vague OKRs that don't drive behavior, and engineering investment invisible to business leadership.

name: Resource Allocation & Tradeoffs
description: Assessed by: headcount proposal success rate, budget utilization vs plan, engineering investment mix (feature/reliability/debt), capacity reallocation speed, and cost-per-engineer-month visibility. Absence causes: resource hoarding across teams, underfunded critical initiatives, headcount misaligned with strategy, invisible engineering costs, and chronic team capacity imbalances.

name: Hiring, Onboarding & Role Design
description: Assessed by: interview scorecard calibration, offer acceptance rate, time-to-productivity for new hires, job description signal quality, and pipeline diversity metrics. Absence causes: long time-to-fill creating delivery gaps, inconsistent hiring bar, talent brand damage from poor candidate experience, slow new-hire ramp eroding team velocity, and role confusion from vague job descriptions.

name: Culture & Norms Shaping
description: Assessed by: psychological safety survey scores, team conflict resolution patterns, norm reinforcement consistency, inclusion metrics, and skip-level sentiment. Absence causes: toxic behavior tolerated from high performers, psychological safety collapse during crises, cultural drift as team scales, and 'missing stair' patterns where everyone routes around known problems.

name: Security & Compliance Posture
description: Assessed by: vulnerability remediation SLAs, security review coverage in design phase, compliance audit findings, incident response readiness, and team security training completion. Absence causes: security incidents from unpatched vulnerabilities, compliance failures creating legal risk, security treated as afterthought in design, and reactive firefighting replacing proactive governance.

name: Performance Management & Calibration
description: Assessed by: performance review completion timeliness, calibration committee rating distributions, PIP conversion rates, feedback delivery cadence, and promotion evidence quality. Absence causes: performance surprises at review time, calibration without behavioral evidence, PIPs used punitively rather than developmentally, high performers under-recognized, and low performers carried indefinitely.
